### Beyond the bomb: When adversaries bring their own virtual machine for persistence


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses a sophisticated cyberattack technique where adversaries deploy their own virtual machines (VMs) within a target's network to maintain persistence. This method allows attackers to operate in a controlled environment, bypassing traditional security measures and evading detection. The use of VMs provides the attackers with a flexible platform to execute malicious activities, such as data exfiltration and lateral movement, without leaving noticeable traces. This new tactic highlights the evolving landscape of cyber threats and underscores the need for enhanced security strategies

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://redcanary.com/blog/threat-intelligence/email-bombing-virtual-machine/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_2564)**

### Trump gives Nvidia green light to sell advanced AI chips to China


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


Former President Donald Trump has reportedly given approval for Nvidia, a leading technology company, to sell its advanced artificial intelligence (AI) chips to China. This decision marks a significant development in the ongoing technological relations between the U.S. and China, especially in the field of AI. The move is seen as an effort to balance competitive interests while maintaining checks on the strategic transfer of technology. This approval could potentially ease tensions and foster business opportunities, although it might also attract scrutiny from those concerned about national security and

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://cset.georgetown.edu/article/trump-gives-nvidia-green-light-to-sell-advanced-ai-chips-to-china/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5096)**

### FACTS Benchmark Suite: Systematically evaluating the factuality of large language models


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article presents the FACTS Benchmark Suite, a comprehensive tool designed to systematically evaluate the factual accuracy of large language models (LLMs). As LLMs are increasingly used in various applications, ensuring their outputs are factually reliable is crucial. The benchmark suite offers a structured methodology to assess these models across different dimensions of factuality, enabling researchers and developers to identify strengths and weaknesses in model performance. The FACTS Benchmark Suite aims to standardize the evaluation process and facilitate improvements in the accuracy and reliability of

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://deepmind.google/blog/facts-benchmark-suite-systematically-evaluating-the-factuality-of-large-language-models/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_3643)**

### Why Isn‚Äôt Online Age Verification Just Like Showing Your ID In Person?


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


Online age verification differs from in-person ID checks due to the complexities of digital identity and privacy concerns. Unlike physical interactions where a person simply shows an ID, online systems must ensure users are of appropriate age without compromising sensitive personal information. The challenge lies in creating secure and reliable verification methods that protect users‚Äô data while effectively restricting age-restricted content. Technological solutions like artificial intelligence, blockchain, and digital ID platforms are emerging to address these issues, but the balance between privacy and security continues to be a

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/12/why-isnt-online-age-verification-just-showing-your-id-person?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_6581)**

### Fortinet FortiGate Under Active Attack Through SAML SSO Authentication Bypass


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses a significant cybersecurity threat targeting Fortinet's FortiGate devices, which are under active attack due to a vulnerability in their SAML SSO (Security Assertion Markup Language Single Sign-On) authentication process. This flaw allows attackers to bypass authentication measures, potentially gaining unauthorized access to sensitive systems and data. The vulnerability underscores the importance of immediate attention and remediation by affected users to secure their systems against exploitations. The article stresses the urgency for implementing patches and security updates released by Fortinet to

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://thehackernews.com/2025/12/fortinet-fortigate-under-active-attack.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5660)**
